Voter Choice MA: RCV Beer Election
all_events.notes:
2 small tables at front door for registration and informational mateiral and ballots. First come first serve basis. Flights will be important to compare beers at the same time. We will be doing $12 flights with $2 going to the organization for each flight. Have  a projector ready and a PA speaker +  two mics in the foods hub space. 7:30pm-8pm speaking in the foods hub space. Have the results also projected in the main taproom space. In additional to the projector in the main taproom space, please have a single mic available hooked up to the main house speakers for brief announcements on the results throughout the event. The flight for the evening will be as follows: 1. Glimpse, Bret Farmhouse
2. Sanctuary gluten reduced Farmhouse
3. A Year with Dr Nandu IPA
4. Robot crush Pilsner

all_events.name: Spring Fest 2017, Powisset Farm
all_events.notes: Rain or shine. Must bring tent and a biergarten table and chairs. Can sell full pours. Hoping for about 1000 guests. Need to bring cups and ice as well. Must check IDs before serving. We will be providing samples and selling full size pours. So we need to bring both sample size cups and full size cups that are compostable if possible as this is a zero waste event. Setup begins at 9am and vendor spots on site are available on a first come ifrst serve basis. We can park our truck in the main driveway as that will be reserved for vendors. Nicole is the contact on site that date at 6176450805. We have already paid the $20 fee for registration.

BeerAdvocate Microbrew Invitational
all_events.notes: Craft will pick up and bring all of our equipment and beers for us. Forrest will prepare the pallet ahead of time on Thursday, June 1 which is prior ot the event. Then Craft will pick up the items on that date for delivery by Friday, June 2 at 9am. At the conclusion of the event, we need to let Craft know that we need them to load out for us and place the tags on our equipment that they will provide for us. Forrest, Mark, Lia, Matt, and Filipe will be on site for both dates. Venue opens at 9am on Friday, June 2 and setup should be complete by 3pm latest. All staff should be ready to go by 5:30pm. Session 1 begins at 6pm and continues until 9:30pm. Clean up by 10pm and closed by 10:30pm. On Saturday, June 3, venue opens at 9:30am and brewery staff should be ready to go by 11:30am on site. Session 2 begins at 12pm-3:30pm and session 3 is from 6pm-9:30pm. It is recommended that each brewery bring 4 styles. They will provide us with ice, 8' table with plastic covering, The remaining items, we must supply.

all_events.name: BeerAdvocate Microbrew Invitational

all_events.name: Laura Casadonte Reservation
Beer Camp Across America 2017
all_events.notes: Festival in Portland Maine. Need to take 1/2BBL of two different styles= 2, 1/2 BBL in total. 2 brewer passes provided upon check in at the event for Ben and Christine. We will be hand delivering out beer on the day of the event. We will need to have the beers on site between ?am-?am which is check period and they will have a refrigerated truck on site. We must bring ID, invoice, jockey box, CO2, keg buckets, and reusable water bottle. They will provide ice, 4ft table, table linen, chalkboard menu sign, and festival glassware. We need to check in between ?am-?am and be ready by no later than ?am to serve. After parking and returning, they will hand you your badges, wristbands, festival glasses, and schedule and map. We will provide 2oz pours. We will load out between ?pm-?pm. please use designated dump stations for ice, beer, and dump buckets. Last call is at ?pm. We will be taking Hop Hop and Year with Dr. Nandu. We will need to bring our own equipment. Will reach out to Vacationland for help in sending our beers. We are shipping our own beers.

Wolf, Greenfield, and Sacks P.C Private Event
all_events.notes: 2 half barrel kegs for their bar, 2 sixtels of a different style each for sample size pours using jockey boxes. We will charge for all beers that we are sending out and staffing costs. They will provide, cups and ice, Forrest will be pouring on site. Their main bar will also be pouring full size portions of our product while we provide tasting sized pours at the table/booth. Try to be at the building at 4:00pm at the latest as the loading dock closes at that time.  Parking: there is a garage located next to 280 Congress Street called Atlantic Wharf Garage that is a short walk to our building. It is between Trade restaurant and Boloco. Your parking fees should be added to any invoice submitted to us for payment along with fees for your participation in the event. We will be taking Hop Hop and Away and Robot Crush.

all_events.name: Old Schwamb Mill Oktoberfest
all_events.notes: 2 jockey box setups. minimum 2 styles of beer. Forrest and Ben will be pouring on site. Target beer price of $6-7. Profit share? They are expecting 250-300 guests. We will be selling all beer on site. Michael will handle COI. We will be pouring under a tent. We need to provide cups and they will provide us with a table or two and we will be serving from under a tent that the organizers will provide.
